tutorial.title: Building Lists
tutorial.descriptionContent: Discover how to build all sorts of cool things with lists in HTML.

lessons.title: Lists
lessons.interactiveContent: Lists in HTML are a lot like regular shopping or to-do lists. They're an excellent tool for organizing information on a webpage.

lessons.title: Ordered list
lessons.interactiveContent:
One type of list is an ordered list.

An ordered list displays a list of numbered items. Like the results of a race.

lessons.title: Ordered lists
lessons.interactiveContent:
An ordered list is made out of <ol> and </ol> tags. The letter O stands for "ordered" and the letter L stands for "list".

Make sure to pick <ol>, followed by </ol>.

lessons.title: Ordered lists
lessons.interactiveContent:
To add a list item, we addÂ text between the <li> and </li> tags. In this case, the L stands for "list" and the I stands for "item".

Make sure to pick <li>, followed by Tortoise, and finally </li>.

lessons.title: Where to put a list item
lessons.interactiveContent:
For lists to be displayed correctly, the list items need to be inside the ordered list element.

Place the list item in the correct place.

Make sure to pick <ol>, followed by <li>Tortoise</li>, and finally </ol>.

lessons.title: Size of a list
lessons.interactiveContent:
Lists can have any number of list items. To add to the list, place additional list items between the <ol> and </ol> tags.

<html>
<body>
Â Â <ol>
Â Â  <li>Tortoise</li>
Â Â  <li>Hare</li>
Â Â </ol>
</body>
</html>]]>

Make sure to pick <li>, followed by Hare, and finally </li>.

lessons.title: Question 1
lessons.interactiveContent:
What are lists used for?

Organizing information on a webpageCreating links

Organizing information on a webpage.

lessons.title: *Question 2
lessons.interactiveContent:
Which tags create a list item?

<li> and </li><ol> and </ol>Just <li>Just </ol>

<li> and </li>.

lessons.title: Question 3
lessons.interactiveContent:
How many list items does this code display on a webpage?

TwoThree

Make sure to pick Two.

lessons.title: Question 4
lessons.interactiveContent:
Which list number will the Croissant item have on this website?

32

Make sure to pick 3.

lessons.title: Example 1
lessons.interactiveContent:
Add an ordered list to this website that lists essential camping supplies.

Make sure to pick <ol>, followed by </ol>.

lessons.title: Example 2
lessons.interactiveContent:
Order these lines of code to create an ordered list of two sequential superhero movies.

Make sure to pick <ol> followed by <li>Avengers</li> and then <li>Avengers 2</li>, </ol>.

lessons.title: Example 3
lessons.interactiveContent:
Put the tags into their correct position. Make sure to add the list item tags inside the ordered list tags.

Make sure to pick <ol> followed by <li> and then </li>, </ol>.

lessons.title: *Example 4
lessons.interactiveContent:
Add the tag to complete the second list item.

Make sure to type <li>.

lessons.title: Unordered list
lessons.interactiveContent: The second type of list is an unordered list. An unordered list displays a list of bulleted items. Like the navigation bar of a website.

lessons.title: Unordered lists
lessons.interactiveContent:
To create an unordered list, we use the <ul> tag. The U stands for "unordered" and the L stands for "list".

Make sure to pick <ul>.

lessons.title: Unordered lists
lessons.interactiveContent:
To add a list item, we addÂ text between the <li> and </li> tags. Just like the list items of an ordered list.

Make sure to pick <li>, followed by Contact, and finally </li>.

lessons.title: Question 1
lessons.interactiveContent:
When are unordered lists useful?

When we want to create bulleted listsWhen we want to create numbered lists

When we want to create bulleted lists.

lessons.title: Question 2
lessons.interactiveContent:
How can we spot an unordered list item on a website?

It has bullet points in frontIt has numbers in front

It has bullet points in front.

lessons.title: Question 3
lessons.interactiveContent:
How do we add a list item to an unordered list?

With the li elementWith the ul elementWith the ol elementWith the </ol> tag

With the li element.

lessons.title: Question 4
lessons.interactiveContent:
How many list items will be on this website?

45

Make sure to pick 4.

lessons.title: Example 1
lessons.interactiveContent:
Use the correct tags to create an unordered list.

Make sure to pick <ul>, followed by </ul>.

lessons.title: Example 2
lessons.interactiveContent:
Assemble the code snippets to complete the last list item.

Make sure to pick <li>, followed by Loch Lomond, and finally </li>.

lessons.title: Example 3
lessons.interactiveContent:
Type in <ul> to start this unordered list.

Make sure to type <ul>.

lessons.title: Example 4
lessons.interactiveContent:
Type in </ul> to close this unordered list.

Make sure to type </ul>.

lessons.title: Links inside a list
lessons.interactiveContent:
List items can contain more than just text. They can also contain images or links.

Give it a go: add a link inside the list item.

Make sure to pick <a href="https://weather.com">, followed by Weather, and finally </a>.

lessons.title: Discovering nested lists
lessons.interactiveContent: List items can even contain other lists.

lessons.title: Starting a nested list
lessons.interactiveContent:
To create a nested list, we start with a simple unordered list and list item.

Finish the list by adding a closing tag for the li element.

Make sure to type </li>.

lessons.title: Finishing a nested list
lessons.interactiveContent:
To finish the nested list, we add an ordered or unordered list as the content of a list item.

Make sure to pick <ol>, followed by </ol>.

lessons.title: Adding list items to nested lists
lessons.interactiveContent:
We add list items to a nested list the same way we add them to other lists.

Add these list items to the nested list.

Make sure to pick <li>, followed by <li>.

lessons.title: Question 1
lessons.interactiveContent:
Can a list item contain an image or a link?

YesNo

Make sure to pick Yes.

lessons.title: Question 2
lessons.interactiveContent:
Can you spot the nested list?

The ordered list is nested in the unordered listThe unordered list is nested in the ordered list

The ordered list is nested in the unordered list.

lessons.title: Question 3
lessons.interactiveContent:
How many nested lists does the unordered list contain?

2104

Make sure to pick 2.

lessons.title: Question 4
lessons.interactiveContent:
What type of bullet will the list item Germany have?

A numberA bullet point

A number.

lessons.title: Example 1
lessons.interactiveContent:
Add the tags to create an unordered list in an ordered list.

Make sure to pick <ol> followed by <ul> and then </ul>, </ol>.

lessons.title: Example 2
lessons.interactiveContent:
Add the tags to create an ordered list inside an unordered list.

Make sure to pick <ul> followed by <ol> and then </ol>, </ul>.

lessons.title: Example 3
lessons.interactiveContent:
Create an unordered list with a Neil Armstrong list item inside the "United States" list item.

Make sure to pick <ul>, followed by <li>Neil Armstrong</li>, and finally </ul>.

lessons.title: Example 4
lessons.interactiveContent:
Complete the nested list.

Make sure to pick <ol>, followed by <li>Cubs</li>, and finally </ol>.

executableContent.instructions: Add two list items with your favorite foods.
